author: barnabasbusa
content:
Do client teams want to trigger eof with `osakaTime` ? 

Could we do something like `eofTime`  - at least until we are not 100% that eof will be in osaka?

author: draganrakita
content: We are 100% sure that EOF is going in Osake and that it will be Osaka first EIP. It make sense to use `osakaTime`.

author: barnabasbusa
content: Ok we can make adjustments to all our tooling for osakaTime then.

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@758579010027782144> and for nethermind it should stick to `eip7692TransitionTimestamp` ?

author: barnabasbusa
content: <@360491619402776577> can you pls ensure that geth is modified to be active with osakaTime?

content: <@316280621783580673> ðŸ™‚ but generally, yes - we active all eips in this way
